instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Not turning On
threads.message:
Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A


It doesn't turn ON.

However when plugged the power without battery the fan starts running at full speed.

By visual inspection. Nothing seems weird.

Reballed the SMC.. Still same beahvior

PPBUS = 15.56V
PP3V42 = 3.42V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.05V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Not turning On
threads.message:
If fan spins, board turns on!
Please, make difference between turn on and booting.

"PPBUS = 15.56V"
Are you sure about this, isn't 12.56V instead?

Inspect <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.
Post voltage for its pins 1, 2, 7, 8.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Not turning On
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Not turning On
threads.message:
You've said to have <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
Are you sure <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> isn't there?

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> must come high, before CPU core rail.
Remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and check its level again.
